Paid parental leave is good for business—but more importantly, it’s good for people. The U.S. is the only industrialized country without mandatory paid parental leave. That needs to change. https://hbr.org/2019/09/every-employee-should-have-access-to-paid-parental-leave …
Shanah Tovah and warm wishes to all those celebrating Rosh Hashanah! Hoping the new year brings peace and joy, especially in these turbulent times around the world.

Thinking about Deputy Dhaliwal and his family. Dep. Dhaliwal sacrificed his life serving his community while breaking barriers. We should all strive to live as courageously and selflessly as he did. https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/27/us/texas-deputy-sikh-shot-and-killed/index.html …

Impeachment isn’t about politics—it’s about defending the Constitution and protecting our country. Here’s to @ElissaSlotkin for showing the definition of political courage. https://www.freep.com/story/opinion/2019/09/25/elissa-slotkin-donald-trump-impeachment/2428906001/ …
If these allegations prove true, the president need only look himself in the mirror to see a traitor.
The whistleblower isn’t a “spy,” he’s a patriot who had the courage to do something extraordinarily difficult for the good of our country. https://twitter.com/latimes/status/1177304816810364933 …

National security is not a partisan issue. Republican attempts to frame this as a political disagreement undermine the gravity of the whistleblower’s complaint.

The safety of our elections and our democracy are at stake.
Everyone should take 10 minutes to read through this letter for themselves. It’s brief, it’s clear, and it leaves no question the president broke the law.

“The President of the United States is using the power of his office to solicit interference from a foreign country in the 2020 U.S. Election."

If this isn't an urgent concern, I don't know what is.  https://intelligence.house.gov/uploadedfiles/20190812_-_whistleblower_complaint_unclass.pdf … pic.twitter.com/JkZAHKzyLm

I had the honor of meeting with Debra & @MarcATice today, whose son Austin has been missing for 7 years after being abducted while reporting in Syria. I admire their strength and courage, and promise we will not give up until Austin comes home. #FreeAustinTice pic.twitter.com/LHkDsI3npE
“The President: I would like you to do us a favor.” https://twitter.com/NBCNews/status/1176862188818051076 …

That’s why I voted for impeachment in 2017 and why this official inquiry is so important. The American people deserve the truth. And they deserve leaders who uphold the Constitution, not trample on it.
Every single member of Congress—regardless of party—took an oath to support and defend the Constitution. The president has no respect for the Constitution and has brazenly acted against it.
These veterans and intelligence officers are leading our caucus. pic.twitter.com/9xsavz7gP7

The president can't use U.S. aid as a weapon to serve his own political purposes. But now that his team has all but admitted he did, Congress can't be afraid to hold him accountable. This is an impeachable offense if true.

Brett Kavanaugh is a liar who has a history of not respecting women. We can’t expect him to uphold the integrity of our country because he doesn’t have any of his own. He should be impeached—something I called for months ago on the steps of the Supreme Court. pic.twitter.com/sD4vLsReGd

We’re ultimately going to win this fight, but we have to do it together. 

Because it’s when our country lets us down the most that we need to work the hardest.

That’s why I’m so proud to represent Massachusetts’ Sixth District in Congress, and also why I ran for president this year—because when my daughter asks me what I did to defeat President Trump and his hateful agenda, I want to be able to tell her that I did everything I could.

Patriotism isn’t hugging the flag, it’s making sure the flag stands for something. 

It’s women marching for basic respect, students walking out for gun reform, and teachers striking for fair pay. 

That’s why we fight today: for our values and for our country.
And we fight to elect Democrats to stand up for patriotism—for taking back that idea from the right-wing politicians who claim to own it.

We fight to elect Democrats to stand up for our democracy. 

In the greatest democracy in the world, we shouldn’t have voter suppression, the filibuster, gerrymandering, or the electoral college to tell people their votes don’t count.
True justice means that we need to start impeachment proceedings for Donald Trump, because neither power nor wealth nor skin color nor office should place anyone above the law.

We fight to elect Democrats to stand up for justice. 

True justice means that we don’t have a racist criminal justice system that kills and imprisons black Americans for doing the same things white Americans do every day.

The right to get the healthcare you need without having to start a GoFundMe account.

The right for women to make their own healthcare decisions about their own bodies with their own doctors, without a male politician or an unworthy Supreme Court justice getting in the way.

We fight to elect Democrats to stand up for basic human rights.

Not the right to carry an AR-15 around; but the right to go to school, or church, or shopping at Walmart and come home in one piece.

In the past few years, Donald Trump and the Republican Party have tried to take us from a country of “yes we can” to a country of “no you can’t.” 

If you’re an immigrant, you can’t dream.

If you’re black, you can’t vote. 

If you’re a woman, you can’t choose.

I think people across America are asking a similar question right now: What does it mean to fight for a country whose leaders let you down? 

The answer today is the same as it was then: we’re fighting to uphold our values that are under attack.
We were right to be asking that question. Because fundamentally, we were fighting in a war that should not have happened—started by leaders who didn’t live up to our values.

The Marines I led in Iraq asked me a lot of questions, from big things like what rocket to use to small things like how to send a postcard to their families. But there was one question that was the hardest: 

“Sir, why the hell are we risking our lives for this?”
I served four combat tours in Iraq—a war I spoke out against—starting as a platoon commander leading part of the first company of Marines into Baghdad in 2003.
I’m speaking at the @massdems state convention today about what it means to fight for our values and what’s at stake in 2020.

We must do better because our veterans deserve better. The VA should be the standard for medical care. https://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/woman-says-father-was-covered-in-ant-bites-before-death-at-va-medical-center/985316944 …
I’m thankful my colleagues in the House are taking the necessary steps to fulfill our constitutional duty and move forward with an impeachment inquiry. It’s long overdue.

I’m thankful Congress was able to extend the 9/11 Victim Compensation Fund to ensure the brave men and women who risked their lives that day will always be taken care of. We can never thank them enough for their service, but we can try.

We will never forget the lives lost 18 years ago today.

We are resilient, we will never stop fighting for our freedom, and we will never forget. pic.twitter.com/3l9Qk06Vy9
I’ll continue to fight for @McCreadyForNC, who has a bright political future ahead of him—whatever he decides to do next.

We have a long road ahead of us to make sure we guarantee every voice is heard and every vote is counted. It’s past time we have a new Voting Rights Act in this country, and it’s something I’ll continue to fight for in Congress.
This is proof Democrats can win anywhere when we have great candidates who embrace our values and have the courage to have honest, frank conversations about how to meet the challenges we face.

This is a seat that shouldn’t have even been competitive—Donald Trump won by nearly 12 points. Despite Republican attempts to literally steal this seat with ballot fraud, Dan didn’t back down, and he made a safe Republican seat competitive.
Dan McCready has spent the last three years campaigning with strength and dignity. Time and again, he has shown us what true, principled leadership looks like.
Again, national security is where Trump is weakest, so Democrats should be confronting him on it more often.

Mental health is just as important as physical health, but there’s still a stigma around mental health care in our country. We need to do everything we can to ensure people are empowered and able to seek the care they need and deserve. #WorldSuicidePreventionDay
Running through three radically different national security advisors in two years is just further proof Trump has no national security policy—not a clue.
